definition: to turn/to twist/to wring/to sprain/to swing one's hips

sentences.english: It seemed as if they derived some sort of twisted pleasure from this brotherly fighting.
sentences.chinese: 這種兄弟相殘似乎使他們獲得了某種扭曲的快感。

sentences.english: His face scrunches up. He begins to cry.
sentences.chinese: 哈雷一言未發，他的面部扭曲着，開始哭泣。

sentences.english: Their way of speaking may become contorted and hard to follow.
sentences.chinese: 他們的語言組織可能會扭曲，很難理解。

sentences.english: He tried to guess how the strata behaved at the time the contortions formed .
sentences.chinese: 他試圖推斷地層在扭曲形成時是如何變化的。

sentences.english: Facial features are distorted in pain.
This alignment of political and business interests has caused huge distortions in China's economy over recent years.
sentences.chinese: 這種政商利益的結合近年來極大扭曲了中國經濟。

sentences.english: Rivals complained about its heavy-handed tactics. pc makers griped that it was hogging the industry's profits.
sentences.chinese: 個人電腦製造商抱怨它扭曲了整個行業的利益。

sentences.english: The distortion psychology of viewpoint on hardship and happiness is to refuse to take on the moral obligation to endanger society.
sentences.chinese: 苦樂觀的扭曲心理是拒絕承擔道德責任而危害社會。

sentences.english: There was a correlation between vertebral artery tortuosity and cervical spondylotic change.
sentences.chinese: 椎動脈扭曲與頸椎退行性變有關。

sentences.english: Since then she has combined her art of contortion with modelling and photography.
sentences.chinese: 此後，她已經扭曲加上她的藝術造型與攝影。

sentences.english: There is much truth in some of the ancient Gnostic texts, though there are also distortions.
sentences.chinese: 目前，在古老的諾斯替文一些很有道理，但也有扭曲。
彎曲的腿和扭曲的指頭。

sentences.english: Earth is working her way back out of distortion in the ever-increasing pace of time.
sentences.chinese: 地球正在不斷加速的時間步伐中脫離扭曲。

sentences.english: Idolatry takes something good and twists it.
sentences.chinese: 拜偶像是對美好的一種扭曲。

sentences.english: Don Juan contorted his face again into a devilish grin and said that the young man declared that he wanted to have the gourds.
sentences.chinese: 唐望扭曲成邪惡的臉孔說，年輕人宣佈他決定要葫蘆。

sentences.english: Two-Face: You thought we could be decent men at an indecent time.
sentences.chinese: 你以爲我們可以在這個扭曲的時代作正直的人。

definition: crash/breakdown (of social values etc)/burst/to crumble/to collapse
deformation/to become deformed/to change shape/to morph
to cut apart/to sever/to separate/to isolate
to rupture/to burst open/to break up
